meanings.definition: Performing the duties expected or required of one; obedient
meanings.sent1: The student was dutiful in completing all his homework assignments on time.
meanings.sent2: She is known for her dutiful attendance at every school event.
meanings.sent3: The dutiful dog fetched the newspaper every morning without fail.
meanings.sent4: The dutiful soldier followed orders without question, like a well-oiled machine.
meanings.sent5: Her dutiful care for the plants made her garden flourish.

meanings.definition: Showing respect and obedience to one's parents or superiors
meanings.sent1: The dutiful son always listened to his parents' advice.
meanings.sent2: She gave a dutiful nod to her boss at the end of the meeting.
meanings.sent3: The dutiful employee brought coffee to the office every morning for the boss.
meanings.sent4: The dutiful servant bowed low before the king, showing utmost respect.
meanings.sent5: His dutiful response to his teacher's instructions impressed everyone.

meanings.definition: Filled with or motivated by a sense of duty
meanings.sent1: The dutiful firefighter rushed into the burning building to save lives.
meanings.sent2: She felt a dutiful obligation to help her elderly neighbor with groceries.
meanings.sent3: The dutiful volunteer spent hours cleaning up the park for the community.
meanings.sent4: His dutiful commitment to his job never wavered, even in difficult times.
meanings.sent5: The dutiful nurse worked tirelessly to care for all her patients.
